sentences.en: A literary prodigy like him is just an exception.
sentences.cn: 像他这样的文学天才只是个例.

sentences.en: But what exactly is a child prodigy?
sentences.cn: 但“神童”到底是怎么定义的?

sentences.en: For further information on the life of William James Sidis, see Amy Wallace, "The Prodigy".
sentences.cn: 想了解关于威廉·詹姆斯·西迪斯生平的更多信息，请参阅埃米·华莱士所著《神童》。

sentences.en: Q: Who is a child prodigy?
sentences.cn: 问: 神童是怎么定义的?

sentences.en: She was a child prodigy on the violin.
She was a child prodigy, giving concerts before she was a teenager.
sentences.cn: 她是个神童，十来岁不到就举办音乐会了。

sentences.en: Something of a prodigy, he quit high school at 17.
sentences.cn: 带有几分传奇色彩的是, 他在十七岁念高中时退学.

sentences.en: That child prodigy began to compose at the age of five.
sentences.cn: 那个神童五岁就开始作诗了.

sentences.en: The man is a prodigy of learning, ie knows a lot.
The prodigy played Carnegie Hall at the age of 16.
sentences.cn: 这位神童16岁就在卡内基音乐厅表演.

sentences.en: The report of such a prodigy awakened my curiosity.
sentences.cn: 这些奇迹的传闻,激起了我的好奇心.

sentences.en: The Russian tennis prodigy is well on the way to becoming the youngest world champion of all time.
sentences.cn: 这位俄罗斯网球奇才已很有望成为历史上最年轻的世界冠军。

sentences.en: They came to see this Russian - born financial prodigy with the Cambridge accent and the Perisian charm.
sentences.cn: 他们纷纷来瞻仰这位俄国出生、带着剑桥口音和巴黎丰采的金融界神童.

words.tran_cn: 惊人的，异常的，奇妙的；巨大的

trans.tran_cn: 奇才，天才（尤指神童），壮举，盛况
trans.tran_en: A prodigy is someone young who has a great natural ability for something such as music, mathematics, or sports
